content:
• Wednesday, March 1, 2017
  • SFTBY

    Moody's: OneWeb merger plan credit negative for Intelsat

    • The plan to merge SoftBank's (OTCPK:SFTBY) OneWeb with Intelsat (I -10.2%) is credit negative, Moody's notes in a new statement.
    • The firm says that's due to the proposal that Intelsat's unsecured debt holders will get a package (including cash, equity and new debt) that's "significantly" less than face value.
    • "At closing, Moody's will likely assess the pending debt transactions as a distressed exchange and limited default," it says.
    • Shares are down more than 24% over two days now since news of the combination came yesterday morning.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:50 PM | 6 Comments
  • ZAYO

    Zayo Group closes $1.42B acquisition of Electric Lightwave

    • Zayo Group (ZAYO +3.3%) has closed on its $1.42B deal for Washington state fiber network Electric Lightwave.
    • The company will "begin cross-selling our full suite of services immediately," says Zayo CEO/Chairman Dan Caruso.
    • Zayo will lay off 20% of EL's workforce, including around 10% at that company's Vancouver headquarters.
    • Electric Lightwave is the fiber portion of a business that split from Integra Telecom, which kept its business offerings of phone and Internet services.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • MDCA

    MDC Partners says DOJ has subpoenaed it for ad industry production probe

    • MDC Partners (MDCA +1.1%) notes in its 10-K filing that one of its subsidiaries received a subpoena from the Justice Dept., part of an ongoing probe into ad industry production practices.
    • The company says it's cooperating fully with the investigation and doesn't think it will have a material adverse effect.
    • A sweeping investigation into industry production practices has hit the world's major ad agencies, including Omnicom, Interpublic Group, Publicis Groupe and WPP.
    • Shares of MDC Partners are a key media mover after hours, up 3.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:56 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    Ballard Power Systems beats by $0.03, beats on revenue

  • PSTG

    Pure Storage -6%; Q4 2017 over estimates, Q1 revenue outlook disappoints

    • Q4 2017 results – revenue $227.9M (+51.7% Y/Y, $3.43M above estimates), EPS -$0.02 ($0.06 above estimates)
    • Q1 2018 projections – revenue $171M-$179M (consensus $201.74M), gross margin 63.5%-66.5%, operating margin -27% to -23%
    • FY 2018 projections – revenue $975M-$1.025B (consensus $1.01B), gross margin 63.5%-66.5%, operating margin -9% to -5%
    • Pure Storage CEO Scott Dietzen: "Pure Storage is delivering the data platform for the cloud era, helping customers put data to work for their businesses. This year, Pure expects to reach $1 billion in revenue - a remarkable achievement and evidence that we're only just getting started. We could not be more excited about the opportunities ahead."
    • After hours – (NYSE:PSTG) $10.64
    • Press release / conference call / CEO blog / 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM | 11 Comments
  • AUPH

    Aurinia's voclosporin meets 48-week endpoints in mid-stage LN study; shares up 43% after hours

    • A Phase 2b clinical trial, AURA-LV, assessing Aurinia Pharmaceuticals' (NASDAQ:AUPH) voclosporin in patients with lupus nephritis (LN) met its 48-week efficacy endpoints.
    • Patients in the low-dose (23.7 mg twice daily) cohort and high-dose (39.5 mg twice daily) cohort experienced statistically significantly greater complete response (CR) and partial response (PR) rates compared to placebo. Specifically, the CR rates and PR at week 48 were 49% and 40%, respectively, and 68% and 72%, respectively, compared to placebo's 24% and 48%.
    • Management will host a conference call tomorrow, March 2, at 8:30 am ET to discuss the results.
    • Share are up 43% after hours on robust volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 42 Comments

    Glaukos EPS in-line, beats on revenue

    • Glaukos (NYSE:GKOS): Q4 EPS of $0.00 in-line.

  • BOX

    Box -2.8%; Q4 2017 over expectations, EPS forecasts off

    • Q4 2017 results – revenue $109.9M (+29.3% Y/Y, $1.04M above estimates), EPS -$0.10 ($0.04 above estimates), cash flow from operations $15M (+$10M Y/Y), free cash flow $10M, billings $159.3M (+22% Y/Y), operating loss $12.7M (vs. $31.1M operating loss Y/Y), net cash provided by operating activities $14.7M (vs. $4.9M Y/Y), free cash flow $10.2M (vs. $21.3M Y/Y)
    • Q1 2018 projections – revenue $114M-$115M (consensus $115.13M), EPS -$0.15 to -$0.14 (consensus -$0.12)
    • FY 2018 projections – revenue $500M-$504M (consensus $500.57M), EPS -$0.49 to -$0.45 (consensus -$0.41)
    • Box co-founder and CEO Aaron Levie: "Fiscal 2017 was a milestone year for Box as we achieved record revenue with growth of 32% year-over-year and delivered on our commitment to generate positive free cash flow for the first time in the fourth quarter. Box is raising the bar in cloud content management. We’ve consistently delivered innovative new products, set the standard for security and compliance, and helped customers in every industry move to the cloud with confidence. We are driving towards a $1 billion long-term revenue target, and this year we plan to invest for scale while continuing to drive operating leverage."
    • After hours – (NYSE:BOX) $17.75
    • Press release / conference call
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM

  • SHAK

    Shake Shack lower after earnings

    • Shake Shack (NYSE:SHAK) reports sales growth of 44% in Q4 off of store growth. Same-shack sales were up 1.6% Y/Y.
    • Shack-level operating profit rose 450 bps to 29.9% of sales as some costs were leveraged down.
    • Average weekly sales for domestic company-operated Shacks increased 1.1% Y/Y to $90K for the quarter as higher menu prices factored in.
    • Previously: Shake Shack EPS in-line, beats on revenue (March 1)
    • SHAK -3.63% AH to $34.81.

  • HIIQ

    Health Insurance Innovations beats by $0.17, beats on revenue

    • Health Insurance Innovations (NASDAQ:HIIQ): Q4 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.17.

  • AVGO

    Broadcom +3.7% as Q1 beats on top, bottom lines

    • Broadcom (AVGO +2%) is up another 3.7% after hours following fiscal first quarter earnings where acquisition-fueled revenue more than doubled and still beat consensus.
    • Guidance for the out quarter was strong as well. Gross margin came in at 62.4%, up from a year-ago 61.1% and last quarter's 60.8%.
    • That's at the top end of previous guidance, says CEO Hock Tan: “We expect healthy demand for our products to continue and we are guiding second fiscal quarter revenue to grow organically by 15% on a year over year basis.”
    • Net revenue by segment: Wired infrastructure, $2.09B (up 441%); Wireless communications, $1.175B (up 103%); Enterprise storage, $707M (up 4%); Industrial and other, $180M (up 29%).
    • For fiscal Q2, it's forecasting non-GAAP net revenue of $4.025B-$4.175M (well above consensus for $3.9B), with gross margin of 61-63%. It sees operating expenses at $789M.
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 5 Comments

  • New funding round for Instacart values it at $3B

    • Instacart is looking to raise up to $400M in a new funding round, according to Axiom.
    • The new round of funding is said to value the companya at $3B.
    • Sequoia Capital is leading the financing deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • DY

    Dycom +17.3% after strong earnings; faster growth expected

    • Infrastructure contractor Dycom (NYSE:DY) is cruising, up 17.3% and near the cusp of a 52-week high, following "very strong" results in its fiscal second quarter earnings after contract revenues rose more than 25%.
    • The sales were up 22.9% on an organic basis as well. EBITDA of $86.2M (12.3% of contract revenues) beat an expected $79.2M, and rose from a year-ago $66.4M.
    • Spending from top customers is only accelerating, says Wells Fargo analyst Jennifer Fritzsche. "We are encouraged to see organic growth re-accelerating in FQ4 to the mid-teens, with its acquired Goodman asset contributing $15M of expected revenue (up from $13.4M in FQ2)."
    • The company also got new customer business from AT&T, Comcast, CenturyLink and Windstream Holdings to support further growth, she notes.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • CMC

    Commercial Metals +3% as U.S. proposes steel rebar dumping margins

    • The U.S. Commerce Department announces preliminary dumping margins on steel rebar imports, saying steel rebar from Japan, Taiwan and Turkey is being dumped in the U.S. market.
    • The agency assigns preliminary margins of up to 209.46% for Japanese exporters, 29.47% for Taiwanese exporters and up to 7.07% for Turkish producers.
    • Commercial Metals (CMC +3.2%) - which petitioned for an investigation along with Gerdau (GGB +4.4%), Nucor (NUE +2.4%) and Steel Dynamics (STLD +3.1%) - is seen as the main beneficiary of the move.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM | 4 Comments
  • PANW

    Palo Alto Networks rated mostly neutral-equivalent and above amid 23.6% post-earnings decline

    • Among widespread ratings and price target modifications following Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW) disappointing Q2 2017 results and forward outlook, concerns over sales issues and competition are generally circulating, though formal analyst Sell indicators remain elusive.
    • Yesterday (February 28, 2017): Palo Alto Networks -14.6%; Q2 2017 revenue and outlook off, LightCyber acquired, $500M buyback authorized / earnings call transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM | 3 Comments
  • DRQ

    Dril-Quip, Frank's cut to Neutral from Buy at Guggenheim

    • Dril-Quip (DRQ -2.7%) and Frank's International (FI) are downgraded to Neutral from Buy at Guggenheim, which cites the companies' high degree of offshore exposure.
    • Guggenheim believes revenue and EBITDA growth of the next 6-8 quarters at DRQ and FI will lag companies with more exposure to the U.S. onshore drilling and completions markets.
    • The firm also says recently released 2017 capex budgets of the offshore-oriented international oil companies suggest few project final investment decisions this year, and on balance no growth in offshore drilling and completions activity.
    • Meanwhile, the firm reiterates its Buy rating on Superior Energy Services (SPN +4.6%) after Q4 results beat expectations and Q1 appears to be off to a good start with the onshore rig count tracking up more than 20% Q/Q.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • SBGI

    Sinclair Broadcast gathers Tennis Media Company assets

    • Sinclair Broadcast Group (SBGI +4.8%) is adding Tennis magazine and Tennis.com as complementary assets to its 24-hour Tennis Channel.
    • Sinclair has used cash on hand to acquire the assets of Tennis Media Company for $8M, with an additional $6M earn-out potential.
    • That brings together tennis platforms on television, print and online, with "significant advantages in the tennis rights and stakeholder world," says Sinclair CEO Chris Ripley.
    • Tennis.com draws 25M monthly page views and 2M unique monthly visitors. Tennis magazine has a circulation of 600,000.
    • Sinclair had acquired Tennis Channel last March, and in the intervening year the network's viewership has increased from 37M homes to close to 50M.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • BITA

    Bitauto +3% as rise in transactions powers revenue beat

    • Bitauto (NYSE:BITA) is up 3% after its Q4 revenues jumped more than 30% and beat expectations.
    • Results were boosted heavily by transaction services, where heavy volume drove a 161% increase.
    • Revenue by segment: Advertising and subscriptions, 929.8M yuan ($133.9M), up 2.2%; Transaction services, 589.2M yuan ($84.9M), up 161.2%; Digital marketing solutions, 230M yuan ($33.1M), up 20.8%.
    • For Q1, considering seasonality, it's guiding to revenues of 1.48B-1.53B yuan -- about $213.2M-$220.4M, in line with expectations for $217.92M.
    • It also named President Andy Zhang to the board of directors, effective today; Vice Chairman Jingning Shao has resigned his post for personal reasons.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM

  • SPWR

    Solar shares sink amid analyst caution on China volumes

    • Solar stocks (TAN -0.7%) are broadly lower, as Roth Capital says it remains pessimistic about solar stocks after strong YTD gains.
    • The firm says H1 could be healthy but it remains cautious on Q3 China volumes and where ASPs may end up after China cuts its Feed-In-Tariffs on June 30.
    • In today's trade: SPWR -5%, FSLR -3.5%, CSIQ -2.2%, ENPH -10%, JASO -1.2%, YGE -4.1%, TSL +0.9%.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 16 Comments
  • MDR

    McDermott +4% after winning offshore subsea contract from Hess

    • McDermott (MDR +3.7%) is on the move after announcing a contract award from Hess (HES +0.6%) for subsea tieback work for its deepwater Penn State Deep field in the Gulf of Mexico.
    • Financial details are not disclosed, but MDR says the lump sum contract will be reflected in its Q1 2017 backlog.
    • Hess recently announced a 2017 E&P capex budget of $2.25B, with $375M earmarked for production activities in the deepwater Gulf of Mexico, including the drilling and completion of a production well at the Penn State field.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM | 15 Comments
  • MGM

    Casino stocks jump after strong Macau numbers

    • The Macau is ripping off strong gains today after an encouraging report came in on February gaming revenue (+18% vs. +10% expected).
    • JPMorgan calls the revenue momentum in the region "remarkable" and says it expects cash flow to continue to improve.
    • Bernstein is impressed by the VIP segment, which it estimates might have generated +20% growth in February.
    • Rally time: MGM Resorts (NYSE:MGM) +2.28%. Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN) +7.12%, Melco Crown (MPEL) +5.13%. Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) +4.31%.
    • Previously: Macau gambling revenue soars in February (March 1)
    • Related ETF: BJK.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM | 10 Comments

    Top brass from Frontline and DHT to meet

    • Top execs with Frontline (FRO +2.2%) and DHT Holdings (DHT +3.3%) plan to meet in the next ten days to discuss Frontline's merger overtures, according to Bloomberg.
    • DHT has rejected two Frontline offers already.
    • Previously: DHT Holdings rejects Frontline again (Feb. 28)

  • X

    U.S. Steel promotes VP/CFO Burritt to President/COO

    • U.S. Steel (X +2%) promotes David Burritt to President and COO after serving as executive VP and CFO since 2013.
    • Mario Longhi, who has served as President and CEO since 2013, will remain the company's CEO.
    • Burritt has assumed increasing responsibility for commercial activities, plant operations and strategic planning since joining the company after 32 years at Caterpillar; he will continue to serve as CFO while the company searches to fill the role.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 3 Comments
  • RESI

    Altisource Residential +3.5% after Q4 results

    • Making a big move in scaling up its single-family rental operation, RESI rental revenues in Q4 of $24.3M compared to $5.7M a year earlier.
    • Property operating expenses were $19M during the quarter. G&A expense of $1.9M; management fees to AAMC of $4.9M.
    • End-of-year rental portfolio of 8,603 homes vs. 2,732 a year earlier.
    • Mortgage loan portfolio of 3,474 loans with UPB of $823.3M vs. 7,036 loans and UPB of $1.8B a year ago.
    • $2.8M of stock bought back during quarter, bringing total buybacks under current program to $46.5M.
    • The purchase of up to 3.5K more rentals from Amherst Holdings is expected to close this month.
    • Shares +3.5% to a new 52-week high of $13.92.
    • Earnings call presentation slides
    • Previously: Altisource Residential misses by $0.84, misses on revenue (March 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • BAX

    Third Point trims Baxter stake over 11%; "pleased" with CEO's performance

    • Institutional shareholder Third Point pares its stake in Baxter International (BAX +0.4%) to 8.5% from 9.6% after selling a block a 5.9M shares. Chief Dan Loeb says he does not intend to sell any more for at least 90 days. The decision to sell was due to valuation after its stake "approached concentration limit guidelines."
    • Mr. Loeb adds that he is "pleased" with the performance of CEO Joe Almeida and is "confident" of his ability to continue to create value for shareholders.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • OXY

    Reuters: Occidental starts to suspend Colombia output after rebel attacks

    • Crude oil production at Occidental Petroleum's (OXY +1.6%) Cano Limon field in Colombia is being gradually suspended after an escalation of rebel attacks on its pipeline, Reuters reports.
    • The 485-mile Cano Limon-Covenas pipeline, which transports crude from the fields to the Caribbean Sea for export, has been suspended since Feb. 15 because of a series of bomb attacks attributed to a Marxist rebel group.
    • A senior military official says 44 of 370 wells are shut down, and storage capacity is at its peak, according to the report.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: DVAX +50%. SKLN +44%. WTW +34%. NDRM +21%. DY +17%. CLNE +17%. PCRX +16%. ODP +15%. FOLD +15%. DMTX +13%. 
    • Losers: BW -39%. IPXL -30%. OASM -23%. PANW -22%. CYBE -19%. APEI -19%. PBMD -16%. ENPH -15%. SDLP -14%. ETSY -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM | 2 Comments
  • MCD

    McDonald's unveils new initiatives

    • McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) reveals at its investor presentation that it will offer a mobile order and pay system by Q4, as well as curbside pickup of orders.
    • Global partnerships with delivery services like Grubhub (NYSE:GRUB) were also mentioned by execs in an initiative that could be scaled up. Also look for the increased use of kiosks at McDonald's restaurants.
    • The company also says it plans to focus on creating a less volatile business model and boosting free cash flow. The restaurant operator notes that it's on track to realize $500M in net G&A expenses by the end of 2018.
    • Management concedes that McDonald's has lost "hundred of millions" visits to other quick service restaurants. Looking ahead, the company sees a greater opportunity in coffee and snacking.
    • Refranchising: The company says it's on track to refranchise 4,000 restaurants by the end of 2017, a full year ahead of schedule.
    • Cash returns: McDonald's announces a new $22B-$24B cash return target for the 3-year period ending 2019.
    • The presentation is still underway.
    • McDonald's investor day webcast
    • Shares of McDonald's are still on a trading halt. They were up 0.33% before the halt started at 10:55 ET. GRUB +1.78%. SHAK +1.84%. HABT +2.23%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM | 18 Comments
  • AMBA

    Ambarella upgraded to Buy at Dougherty & Company amid 5.5% post-earnings reduction

    • From Neutral, analyst Charles Anderson views Ambarella's (NASDAQ:AMBA) story "cleaner" sans GoPro. Price target $75 (current price $55.71).
    • Yesterday (February 28, 2017): Ambarella -5%; Q4 2017 over estimates with revenue outlook off, $75M buyback authorized / earnings call transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM | 4 Comments

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: SPAR +6%. LDL +6%. NAV +5%. SUP +5%. LFVN +5%.
    • Losers: KEQU -11%. STKL -7%. NVFY -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • WMB

    Williams Cos. added to Goldman's Conviction Buy list, Hess removed

    • Williams Cos. (WMB +2.2%) is upgraded to Conviction Buy from Buy at Goldman Sachs, which cites the 38% total return potential to its unchanged price target of $38.
    • Goldman says the market is not appreciating WMB's "visible, low-risk" organic growth and strong free cash flow generation, TheFly.com reports.
    • WMB's strong cash generation will allow the company to boost its dividends in the coming years and hit the high end of its guidance for 10%-15% annual dividend growth through 2020, the firm says.
    • Goldman also removes Hess (HES -0.3%) from its Conviction Buy list.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 5 Comments
  • HABT

    Habit Restaurants +2% after McDonald's trading halt

    • Habit Restaurants (NASDAQ:HABT) breaks higher after a trading halt on McDonald's sets off a guessing game with investors on if the company is announcing a merger.
    • HABT +2.25% to $13.75 after sitting in negative territory when the MCD halt started.
    • Previously: Shake Shack moves higher amid McDonald's trading halt (March 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 4 Comments
  • BHP

    Strike at BHP's Escondida mine turns violent as protesters battle police

    • The three-week-long strike at BHP Billiton's (BHP +2.7%) Escondida copper mine in Chile reportedly has turned ugly, as a group of protesters blocked a highway and provoked a confrontations with police.
    • The events reflect the increasing bitterness and division between the two sides, whose positions still appear to be far apart; key differences include disagreements over the level of benefits new workers should receive, and planned changes to shift patterns and benefits.
    • The union also says BHP had failed to make back payments to workers, while the company says it will make the payments once the strike is over; a local judge ruled yesterday that a deferred payment from 2016 should go out to workers within 48 hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • KMX

    CarMax lower on report of Chanos short position

    • CarMax (KMX -1.1%) trades lower after CNBC reports that Jim Chanos has issued a short call on the retailer.
    • Shares of  CarMax were up 2.9% earlier.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 2 Comments
  • SHAK

    Shake Shack moves higher amid McDonald's trading halt

    • Shake Shack (NYSE:SHAK) is up about 1.2% since a trading halt on McDonald's fired off about 30 minutes ago ahead of a pending news announcement.
    • McDonald's is in the middle of its investor day presentation in Chicago,
    • The mini-rally on Shake Shack is based on speculation, there's nothing concrete to suggest McDonald's is making a M&A announcement.
    • Previously: Trading halt on McDonald's (March 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • E

    Eni close to finalizing deal to sell stake in Mozambique gas field, CEO says

    • Eni (E +1.9%) is “within weeks” of sealing a multibillion-dollar deal to sell a stake in its Mozambique operations, CEO Claudio Descalzi tells the Financial Times.
    • Descalzi does not identify the buyer, but Exxon Mobil (XOM +2.1%) is considered the most likely candidate because the company also has exploration licenses in the country.
    • The sale is expected to be followed later this year by the final go-ahead for its multibillion-dollar Coral South field, the first part of the Area 4 block due for development.
    • Eni also presents a four-year strategic plan that calls for a 16% Y/Y capex cut this year and another €5B-€7B in disposals following €20B of asset sales over the last four years.

    • Freeport McMoRan's (FCX +2.7%) Indonesian unit sees "no returning to business as usual," according to an internal company memo, after the company cut production and laid off workers at its Grasberg copper mine in a battle with the government over mining rights.
    • Reuters reports that the unit said in a memo to staff yesterday that it had shelved plans to invest $1B/year in long-term underground expansion at Grasberg, and that copper ore output from the mine would be cut to 95K metric tons/day in 2017 from 140K metric tons previously estimated.
